009package Filters;
010import java.util.Random;
011
012import ij.ImagePlus;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015
016/**
017 * Simple version of the Jitter filter. Works for all image types
018 * but does not handle image borders.
019 * The input image is destructively modified.
020 * 
021 * @author wilbur
022 * @version 2016/11/01
023 */
024public class Jitter_Filter_Simple implements PlugInFilter {
025        
026        int rad = 3;    // the radius (should be user-specified)
027                
028        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
029                return DOES_ALL;
030        }
031
032        public void run(ImageProcessor ip1) {
033                final int w = ip1.getWidth();
034                final int h = ip1.getHeight();
035                
036                Random rnd = new Random();
037                ImageProcessor ip2 = ip1.duplicate();
038                
039                final int d = 2 * rad + 1;      // width/height of the "kernel"
040                
041                for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
042                        for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
043                                int rx = rnd.nextInt(d) - rad;
044                                int ry = rnd.nextInt(d) - rad;
045                                // pick a random position inside the current support region
046                                int p = ip2.getPixel(u + rx, v + ry);
047                                // replace the current center pixel
048                                ip1.putPixel(u, v, p);
049                        }
050                }
051        }
052        
053}
